p: Delonix regia (Bojer ex Hook.) Raf., known as Krisnachura in Bangladesh is a species of flowering plants, belonging to the family of Fabaceae. It is also known as flame tree as it has beautiful red flowers. The tree is a native to Madagascar and widely planted as ornamental trees in many countries of the tropical region [ 5]. The flowers traditionally been used to treat constipation, inflammation, rheumatoid arthritis, diabetes, pneumonia, and malaria [ 6]. The leaf extracts of this plant have been reported to be used as antimicrobial, antioxidant, antihyperglycemic, anti-inflammatory, cytotoxic and hepatoprotective agent [ 5, [7], [8], [9]]. The stem bark extracts were found to have antioxidant and antimicrobial properties [ 10, 11].
